name: Marco Polo Plaza

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for an overnight stay with my family and I would say that I did not regret choosing Marco Polo. Service was excellent starting from the moment we arrived until check-out. They made it sure that you are treated with care no matter if you are staying as a foreigner or a local resident.
reviews.title: A wise choice indeed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Filipino hospitality was at its best and most of the employees were very courteous and friendly. They would greet and smile at you when you pass each other. They respectfully answer your answers if you have questions.
reviews.title: Great service and a tremendous atmosphere

reviews.text: We stayed in a mountain view deluxe room and from what I have observed, everything was clean and arranged very well. We also did not experience any problems with the aircon.
reviews.title: Hospitable, comfortable, and an exquisite food selection

reviews.text: We availed of the weekender package so we had a taste of their pizza for free at El Viento Restaurant. I have also enjoyed dipping in their 4 meter pool at 10pm. There were few guests swimming around at that time so I took advantage of exclusively using their pool with my beau. Though it was late already, the staff did not hesitate to accommodate us.
reviews.title: Best City hotel in town. With great al fresco restaurants

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet at Cafe Marco was a feast with a bountiful supply of foods available for everyone of different cultures.
reviews.title: Filipino Hospitality at its Finest!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has been ages since we last stayed here. It really has lots of improvements since becoming an accredited GHA hotel. The rooms are exactly styled like all Marco polo hotels. I really appreciate the local chocolate "tableya" specially wrapped and left at the bedside table.......a very special gesture of welcoming a guest.
reviews.title: beyond 5 star experience!!!!

reviews.text: In the basement level, the hotel has a gym, a spa and a beauty parlor where you can have your hair and nails done before an event. No need to rush to the mall to have one.
reviews.title: Perfect business hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet offers a wide selection specially the fresh fruit platter. I specially like the fresh guyabanos which are seasonal and rarely offered in other 5 star hotel in Cebu.
reviews.title: Long term guest

reviews.text: They now have free shuttle service to the Ayala and SM malls. Seats are limited though so you have to sign up early.
reviews.title: Noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cafe Marco has the best buffet in town!!! I love their japanese and chinese buffet the most. Its like quality of food comparable to Hong Kong. Go to the top most floor of the hotel to capture the breathtaking night view of the city. The blu bar also offers very good desserts and also serves alcoholic beverage- a good hangout place. The eternity pool is also very nice. Try their lechon pizza, its only in cebu and its one of the best that i have tried. Stayed in their deluxe room and the service was great! Im definitely coming back!
reviews.title: My Favorite Hotel

reviews.text: I had stayed a couple of times at the Marco Polo on my last visit. They had admitted me to their frequent guest club and everything seemed to be going along well, until it wasn't. I was at this hotel specifically because I ran a company branch in Cebu, so this hotel needed to "work" for me from a business perspective. First problems started occurring when the in room web service failed me miserably. I had a client call scheduled and desperately needed to "connect". Several repeated calls to the front desk resulted in me waiting and waiting until they could locate someone who could help. I wish I could describe the dialogue in this calls, but it would require me to use profane language which is inappropriate here. Let's talk about their "loyalty" program. On the surface it offered some really special perks, evening cocktails, daily breakfasts and an opportunity to bring a "guest", mind you this was predicated on my paying a higher room fee, but it seemed to make sense to me. As a any logical person might do, I used the free breakfast offer and brought a guest, daily, until the woman who monitored the "loyalty lounge" breakfast facility provided me with a check for the breakfast charges of my guest. I protested, telling her I had a letter in my room that outlined my right to bring a guest. Essentially, she called me a "liar" without saying the words. I paid the bill, so as to avoid being pegged a theif and went to my room to retrieve the letter. When I brought it right back to her, she admitted she knew some letters said this, but after the fact they decided this was too expensive and retracted the program. I want to be clear, I was offered a program upon check in, and it was rescinded mid-stay, but mostly, I dearly appreciated being made to feel like a liar in a business setting. I spoke to the hotel manager who was too busy to be bothered with how upset I was and sent a "stand in" to discuss all of these issues. I am not sure what happened to the old adage that the customer is always right, but this pompous, arongang woman sat in front of me and tried to make me feel like I was someone out of line and wrong for my complaints. Needless to say, I told her the conversation was over. Never once did I stay at this hotel again. It is old and it smells. The restaurant is no where near as clean as some of the other comparable hotels in Cebu and overall, as a business traveller with service needs, I would much rather poke my eye out with a pair of scissors than ever return to this hotel. Believe me, if you actually need the hotel to assist you, do not waste your time here.
reviews.title: Pompous, Arrogant Staff with Complete and Utter Disregard for Guests

reviews.text: The rooms are similar to Marco Polo Hong Kong. Friendly staff. Great place where you can relax and enjoy.
reviews.title: Luxury Hotel in Cebu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall stay was great.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Cebu

reviews.text: High quality hotel with reasonable prices. Location is high on a hill overlooking Cebu and the waterfront. Best part is the Blu open air skybar/restaurant located on top floor of the hotel. Has gret views off city in the evenings.
reviews.title: A Home Away from Home

reviews.text: Marco Polo Plaza in Cebu is a retreat from the bustling city life of Cebu. A growing metropolis Cebu is experiencing the same issues like any other pollution, heavy traffic and people packed malls, restaurants and shopping strips. The family spent just an overnight at the hotel but we were impressed with the service, the facilities and the well trained staff. Located atop the hills, one can have a breathtaking view of the skyscapes of the city and at night one will be mesmerised by the beautiful cityscape ablazed with neon and street lights. I had a slight cut and the nurse came with a small band aid for my use. It really feels at home in a grand hotel like Marco Polo in Cebu.
reviews.title: Good Value and Service

reviews.text: I love the hotels food ,wine collection , ambiance at the Continental Club ( im sure its more romantic at night when all the city lights are lit before your eyes ) and the staffs efficiency- i called to reserve a Cecile Licad concert seat and i got the needed attention 'ahora mismo' ...
reviews.title: Marco Polo Plaza Cebu - I Love !!!

reviews.text: Moreover ,The Marco Polo's Spring Chicken , Pizza Pie ,The Salmon Fillet is just sooo goood !! Thanks to F and B manager Mr Stephan Wieprick , Food Consultant Mrs Jessica Avila and MarcoPolo's Marketing Manager Yumz Mariott !!
reviews.title: Hotel uphill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's quite good to stay in a hotel with a view of downtown Cebu especially at night. I'm not just comfortable swimming in their pool maybe due to its location, facing the restaurant. It's good also for them to have a shuttle bus going to SM and Ayala mall. I will definitely staying here again.
reviews.title: Good, but not great

reviews.text: The rooms at the Marco Polo are very average, a bit weathered and worn with warped ceiling cracks, a tired bathtub and creaking floors, but for the price we paid (less than $70 per night) you couldn't expect more.
reviews.title: Marco Polo Cebu Excellent

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet, as noted in other reviews, is decadent featuring everything you would expect in such a buffet and much, much more: fresh baked breads, pastries, eggs made to order, cereals, pancakes, waffles, cheeses, miso soup and sushi. However, the breakfast comes with a significant mark-up in the nightly rate ($30 more per night per room, or paid on admittance $15 per person).
reviews.title: Best place for a wedding reception!

aka: Marco Polo Plaza Hotel Cebu City
